website_summaries.verdict: At a fraction of the price of other models, this fan is a great deal for the performance.
pros: Powerful enough to efficiently move air out of a small bathroom
cons: It is the loudest fan on our list

customer_reviews.title: Great fan, great price.
customer_reviews.text: Nice fan, very easy to replace our old fan. It is not whisper quite, which is what we wanted. We don't want a silent fan in our bathroom, we want it to give us a little privacy with thenoise it makes. This did that for us. It is also not extremely loud.
customer_reviews.author: J.Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Model numbers matched, but didn't fit for replacement
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace a non working motor and although my old fan was model 663/688, this did not fit. The plug inlet was oriented in a different spot and the motor mount was opposite on my old fan. Frustrating that this listing had so few specs and detail and no photos of the "guts" of the fan. If it had, I would have known this was the wrong replacement. Hopefully these photos will help others. Also it's a cheap price, but an equally cheap product - Note the poor blade-to-shaft connection, looks like it would melt off if someone accidentally left the fan running too long.
customer_reviews.author: GDLeo

customer_reviews.title: A dependable work horse! A+
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these to switch out all the fans in our house as it's coming up on 13 years... The fan we use the most is starting to make a louder death raddle-like sound... The replacement video I found on YouTube was pretty straight forward. However, my fan replacement attempt was haulted abruptly when a bunch of loose sheet rock dust flew right into my eye when I tried to remove the plastic fan plate. It was by sheer luck that I didn't fall down the ladder when I jerked so suddenly being hit in the eye with debris. In conclusion. Love this product. Easy to install. Very straighg forward. My only word of advice? Wear goggles. 😂
customer_reviews.author: Alice Yeh

customer_reviews.title: Easy fix...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased 2 of these to replace the builder grade fans over 20 years ago. We pulled one fan down, and matched the manufacturer and size as best we could. This device slid right in the to housing subset into the ceiling drywall. We didn't need the housing!!! I cleaned the housing and back box with the vacuum and as best I could into the little duct. In the end, it was a simple plug--- that was right there in the back box. 40 year old chic home owner on a step ladder... Watch a You Tube video and be brave... This was an easy fix!!!! Wow, the other options were high priced at Lowe's and Home Depot.
customer_reviews.author: PissyKrissy

customer_reviews.title: Its quite what I expected just like the last one
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my old one that lasted 20yrs. This is the same brand as my old one, had a hard time pulling the old one out actually had to go in the attic lucky manhole cover in the bathroom. Its quite what I expected just like the last one. Installation wasn't bad if you know what your doing. The metal has very sharp edges so be careful. Power wires a little struggle to put inside the small box. Seating the internal fan itself in the box afterwards kinda a pain to finally get it to sit right. Took a total of an hour to install.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Florez

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement for older 688-H models of the same
customer_reviews.text: Great. We used these to replace the fan motor and mount plate on older versions of these. Our old models were 688-H. What arrived were newer 688-K models. The inside fan, motor and mount plate went right in to the old housing. The Broan web site has parts diagrams for the different models of these 688 fans. It would have been helpful in the above product listing to know which exact model would ship, but we took a chance after looking at the Broan web site and were pleased with the results. These are small fans with not a ton of suction, and not the quietest, but in replacing an existing installation of the same, these were a great find.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A

customer_reviews.title: Easy replacement for a builders standard fan
customer_reviews.text: Very easy replacement for the original fan that was put in when the house was built. When I took the broken one out, I found out that the builders had filled a lot of the fan with plaster as they obviously installed it before they sprayed the ceiling. It is a miracle that it has lasted over 15 years. This replacement fitted in the same hole and used the same exhaust pipe. It should be possible to replace it from the bathroom but I chose to go up in the attic so that I could do a better job of ensuring that it is tightly sealed to prevent drafts. It now runs quietly and smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: CGT

customer_reviews.title: I should’ve spent the money
customer_reviews.text: This is one case where you get what you pay for. It is the noisiest fan I have ever heard in my life. If I didn’t already pay someone to cut through the Sheetrock and install it, then spackle, sand and paint, I would’ve ripped it off the ceiling! Thank God I got this for a rental. I feel bad for my poor tenant though. Spend $40 or $50 more and enjoy the peace.
customer_reviews.author: Nisscasa

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad!
customer_reviews.text: It's a $14 exhaust fan, it's not the prettiest grille but very functional! Nice snug fit for my old fan that was from the early 90s. Cannot beat this price. Hope it lasts!
customer_reviews.author: John Thatcher

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the bathroom as an exhaust for steamy showers and moisture!
customer_reviews.text: Well known brand, easy to read and install without a problem.! Easiest way to install this would be from the attic (if you can). Otherwise setup and installation is a breeze. Connected to the bathroom light fixture so that whoever uses the bathroom turns on both the light and the fan at the same time. Broan is an excellent brand for these devices. Also note, the opening is 3" to exhaust, however you can purchase a adapter to use a 4" flexible aluminum exhaust to the roof opening. Does a great job to exhaust moisture and prevent mold build-up. Would highly recommend for any bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Adam

customer_reviews.title: Fixed my exhaust in 10 minutes flat
customer_reviews.text: We had the exact model as this in our house and the motor had burnt out. We opened the old one and took out the motor. It was literally plugged into an outlet in the ceiling. Then we put this one in place and plugged it in. WALAH!!! it worked. We put the new cover on and done. I've never been so happy with a home repair.
customer_reviews.author: Mary L

customer_reviews.title: bathroom exhaust fan
customer_reviews.text: Product works well for what we intended however need to be able to turn off when wanted. We wired into the light switch which is challenging. We use a small heater to warm bathroom when showering, the fan exhausts heat so have to disconnect during showers. We'll have to install a switch to turn in off or wire directly into power with its own on/off switch. It would be helpful if it had an inline thumb switch (in our case). Note all power in our bathroom, heater, lights, fan, ele outlet are all fed thru the one on/off switch. Poor original planning for electrical installation in our 36 year old build.
customer_reviews.author: Eve C Johnson-Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement for older Broan 688-H
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a 25 year old 688-H model fan. It's still super loud, but it does its job. I did not change out the baffle or the housing since they were in good shape still, just the section with the motor and the fan. Just needed a flathead screwdriver or a small pry bar to loosen the side with 1 tab tucked up and I was able to drop it down from that side. Cant complain at all for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Justin M

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install, and rather quiet...we like it.
customer_reviews.text: Received today, put it in in about an hour, it only took so long because the person who put the shell for the fan didn't really secure it well, and they didn't do the wiring the way I do, so i rewired it. I wrap and I also connect the ground, neither one they did. I love Broan, you take out the old, snap in the new. This one is much more quiet than the last one we had. as to suction, time will tell. When nothing is left in this world that is standard, Broan seems to have kept to a standard. Which makes installation so much easier, if you had Broan before.
customer_reviews.author: Neoma G. Zimitravich

customer_reviews.title: Great, inexpensive exhaust fan, but it's LOUD
customer_reviews.text: This is so well priced and has some of the best reviews for exhaust fans so I couldn't pass it up. I purchased a flat cover to give it a more custom look and to make it easier to keep clean (also on Amazon Universal Clean Cover #FG701S). I paid for professional installation which took two people less than an hour and works perfectly. I think it looks great. The only down side is that it is louder than I might have liked. But it's for my guest bath and for the price I paid (about $15), I can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: FinAndMarketing

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: The fan in the bathroom never worked when I moved into my place. I looked for a replacement fan. IT was cost 3 times what a fan kit would cost. I got the kit, pulled the fan unit out and replaced the old worthless fan. BTW, there are plenty of YouTube videos on how to replace a fan. Works perfectly and now the bathroom no longer fogs up. It's a real shame that sellers sell the fan for far more than it's really worth. If you need to replace a broken fan, get the full kit and you'll save money.
customer_reviews.author: KLH

customer_reviews.title: Decent exhaust fan
customer_reviews.text: This was the original fan (Part number slightly different but indicated as the replacement) our builder used 13 years ago. Gets used most days. Wife thought it was getting noisier. I cleaned the last time and it helped (Build up of dust) but this time she thought it did not help. Due to age I decided to replace. It was drop in interchangeable so easy to swap out. I would have considered another brand that would have been less noisy but decided to keep it easy and it did hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: KTown

customer_reviews.title: Probably not a great product for typical home use
customer_reviews.text: Probably not a great product for typical home use, but perfect for my use. I needed to exhaust solder fumes from my workshop and this fan works great. It is quite small and doesn't have a huge airflow, but I didn't need a lot. Very pleased with the purchase for my application.
customer_reviews.author: KevinGa

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this exhaust to replace a 12 yrs old fan which pretty much looked the same, when the electrician installed he realized that the connection from the old fan was square and this one was round, several adjustments had to be made which took a lot longer to complete the job and a frame had to be made to cover the corner gaps, apparently the measurements were off by 1/2 inch.
customer_reviews.author: Rita P.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome donor motor/fan
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace the motor in our 29 year old Broan bathroom fan. Didn't want to go to the hassle of replacing the old housing. Had removed the old motor many times and cleaned and lubed it but it was time to replace. All I needed was a tin snips to cut off part of the new housing surrounding the motor shaft, flip a couple screws around, and it bolted right into the old assembly with no issue. Works great and cheaper than trying to purchase just a new motor!
customer_reviews.author: Joe N9OK

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for the original that came with the house!
customer_reviews.text: Now, im not one of those strange folk who like to go in complete silence. This fan is loud, just how i like it! And cheap! The one i had originally was starting to make funny noises, so I opted to replace it. Funny enough, it is the exact same type that came with my house. Why change something if it is already perfect? I removed the old fan and replaced it with the new one without even needing to get into my attic! Do recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Solid buy for replacement or new installation.
customer_reviews.text: Reliable standard unit, easily installed. A bit noisy, but it did say that and I did not want to spend the money on the more muffled versions. Ideal for rental units, or for powder rooms where fan is not so frequently used. Noise gets it 4, but for the price, reliability, and clean looks, this is a solid buy.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Mollenhour

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far it's been great, I wanted a fan with noise because I dont want people hearing other people doing the business in the restroom...(why would ya want to hear that? Lol) when i take a warm shower the wondows don't get all foggy, had to replace the fan with the one that came with the house. Didn't realize when I asked my buddy to install it it would mean him going up the attic and installing....so just be aware of that...and the mess it'll leave down below for installation . *only had it for a month now but it works great
customer_reviews.author: Retrogal1949

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: I gave it five stars because for what it is, an inexpensive fart fan, it's perfect. I pulled the fan assembly out of the housing and used it to replace the bad one in my 15 year old Broan 688K. It took all of 5 or 6 minutes. These are inexpensive builder grade fans. If I was completely remodeling I'd look for something a little quieter but it was too easy to simply replace this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jim C

customer_reviews.title: Noisy
customer_reviews.text: I needed an exhaust fan in the basement for cigarette smoke and thought the sones rating wouldn't be a factor, but I was wrong. Didn't install up in a ceiling like a bathroom but in between the floor joists and venting it outside, but it's so annoyingly loud that it disturbs a conversation. It was very easy to install and it does a good job sucking out the smoke but if piece and quiet is a factor ... Avoid
customer_reviews.author: E3 Lohrer

customer_reviews.title: Just buy the motor
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace an existing worn-out and very noisy fan. Installing a complete replacement would have meant tearing out the sheet rock ceiling around it in order to attach it to the joist, so I bought what was listed as the same model number, intending to simply swap the motor and fan deck. Unfortunately, while the dimensions are the same, the interior design and mounting of the fan deck have been significantly changed, so a direct swap is not possible. I had another use for the new assembly, so I went back online and bought a replacement motor from an off-brand supplier, which is working fine.
customer_reviews.author: B. H. Hertlein

customer_reviews.title: Good Bathroom Fan For The Price
customer_reviews.text: I really needed to replace my bathroom fan & got this. And for less than $15 I'd definitely recommend it. It's got pretty good suction power & after showering it made a huge difference compared to my old bathroom fan. But my only complaint is that it's kinda noisy.
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: This is a quite noisy fan
customer_reviews.text: I have this fan for a little bit over 2 months and today its motor started making a grinding noise whenever I turn it on. I don't think a bathroom fan should be that short life . It is cheap but I think it should be designed better. Not impress.
customer_reviews.author: R L

customer_reviews.title: not really a good fit
customer_reviews.text: I figured that this would be the same size frame as the one it was replacing, and it was not. It is hanging down from the ceiling a bit and I can see all the old lines where the other one was sitting on the ceiling. We actually had to use the old housing because this one would have required all re routing of the venting. It was cheap and delivered quickly, but a mediocre product.
customer_reviews.author: Merri Ann Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: THE HORROR!
customer_reviews.text: This is used in a half bath so I can't tell you how it works with humidity suction. It cleans the smells pretty quickly though. It's kinda loud but maybe that's good so that you don't have to hear everyone's bodily functions. Our old one was getting quiet but as it got quieter it also worked less. One day after a family Taco Bell dinner it just said "THE HORROR! THE HORROR!" Then it died. This product has been a good replacement.
customer_reviews.author: L. Caron

customer_reviews.title: It sucks as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Bought this knowing it would be high sonne, high dB so I could install in guest bath. Now they can use facilities without worrying about embarrassing sounds as the fan masks them. Removes odor from a 8x4 guest bath, not meant to be high suction or extraction. If you have a large bathroom to vent, you will need a bigger fan.
customer_reviews.author: happy

customer_reviews.title: Easy swap out for my existing fan
customer_reviews.text: I got these because my current Broan 688 fans were getting loud and making weird noises. The fan on these units are easy to remove and were designed to be swapped out, so I don't have to pull the whole box out of the ceiling or mess with the electrical. Decided to swap all of my Broan 688 fans.
customer_reviews.author: S. Barrick

customer_reviews.title: This is a complete replacement
customer_reviews.text: Great price and works great. I had to replace the motor on the old 688 but found the plate that motor is mounted on do not match. You would have to remove the old fan assembly and install new box and fan plate. So I removed the motor from the new plate- added some washers to help new motor (that is slightly different) fit on old plate. Installed old plate with new fan and works great. (I should have bought an upgrade kit (comes with 2 motor mounting plates, motor and fan)- but would have cost 3 times as much.
customer_reviews.author: Reynaldo Bazan

customer_reviews.title: Loud as a jet engine
customer_reviews.text: It’s almost a joke how loud this thing is. It’s like you’re notifying everybody whenever you make a bad smell in the bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Libertarian

customer_reviews.title: worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I am not what I would consider a "handy person" yet I managed to install this ceiling fan myself in about an hour. The fan is noisy but I figure I don't have it on unless I'm showering so the noise doesn't bother me. My bathroom is fairly small- 5feet x 7.5feet and the suction works great. My mirror is not foggy if I run the fan while I'm in the shower.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: What a deal for my money...
customer_reviews.text: It isn't eh quietest but we are fine with that. I small amount of noise sometimes allows for a little more privacy and my family is fine with that. It pulls the moisture out the air and does the job it promises. The price is almost unbelievable, I wasn't sure what I was going to get. I am Pleased and glad I gave this a chance.
customer_reviews.author: Poppy C.

customer_reviews.title: Good value over-all but pretty loud.
customer_reviews.text: If you just need a cheap replacement and don't care about some extra noise, it's a very good value. However, I'd consider another model if you are sensitive to background noise. I could see this being a problem if you use hearing aids or other devices which make background noise problematic.
customer_reviews.author: LMI

customer_reviews.title: Fits and installs into ceiling.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a replacement fan at the local home improvement store, but it was too big to fit into the ceiling! I found this fan on Amazon and ordered it to see if it would be easier to install. It was and I was able to install into the ceiling cavity relatively easy. It works great and I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Whittington

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement for the 688-J
customer_reviews.text: The motor went out in one of our vent fans and was extremely noisy in another. They were both model 688-J. The replacement motors were $20+. These were $14 and the interior components were a perfect fit. Save me a little money and a lot of time. They are not whisper quiet but they are no louder than the originals.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Wallerstein

customer_reviews.title: This makes it easy!
customer_reviews.text: My Broan that is in the house when we bought is 16 years old and got noisy. It was easier and cheaper to buy this complete fan than to buy replacement parts. I popped the guts out of the new unit and it snaps right into the old Broan housing. Takes ten minutes if the original is Broan.
customer_reviews.author: Billtheplumber

customer_reviews.title: Not as described.
customer_reviews.text: I attempted to install but it is not the same size as the original. Could not even removed the fan and swap it for the original. Appears that the manufacturer changed everything from the original. Will not be ordering from this seller in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Works for the cost
customer_reviews.text: It is quite loud but not to the point that it is annoying. I bought this to replace the previous fan that is rusted. I did not replace the entire fan but just the motor. This is much much easier. You can find how-to videos on Youtube. The size fits well.
customer_reviews.author: Aloy

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great fan for $15. Seriously! It is fairly quiet. The only thing that I can complain about, if I had to, is the lack of suction. But, it is a $15 fan! I needed a new cover and thought for $5 more I would try this fan. I am glad I did.
customer_reviews.author: Rkruse3

customer_reviews.title: fine fan, good value.
customer_reviews.text: take it apart and use it as a personal directional fan. quite a breeze, and very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: lmc

customer_reviews.title: suck out the mojo
customer_reviews.text: Greatest thing since sliced bread especially if u have a wife who eats the most ungodly food and tries to share it with everyone later! This fan has good cfm and is pretty quite. Not a bad investment in my case.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Troxel

customer_reviews.title: Broan backwards compatibility is my friend.
customer_reviews.text: Did you know that you can pop out your old Broan fan, take the guts out of this, and pop it right into your ceiling with little to no trouble? The casing is the same and has little divots. It is pretty easy. So I took the guts out of my existing fan, put this in, plugged it in, put on the cover, and I was done. Very little effort. New fan. Everyone is happy. Compatibility is key.
customer_reviews.author: Clouded sulphur

customer_reviews.title: Repurposed fan and motor in exisiting higher end unit fan light unit.
customer_reviews.text: Saved a ton of cash by reusing this motor in our much more expensive fan light combo! Just removed the motor mounts and installed in our old unit.
customer_reviews.author: Maracuja

customer_reviews.title: Easy drop in replacement.
customer_reviews.text: This is a basic, cheap and dependable fan. We were lucky and the same (but much older version) of this fan was already installed in our bathroom. This was an easy swap in replacement that didn’t require replacing the entire enclosure. Took about 10 minutes and half of that was cutting the breaker and getting a ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Good air flow
customer_reviews.text: Surprised by how much air this draws. Much quieter that the ~26 y.o. original bath fan. A little difficult to install plate that encloses the wiring after putting twist caps on the wiring, but it finally worked.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exact replacement for the fan in the bathroom of my 15-year-old house, and great price!
customer_reviews.text: So happy I found this, it is the exact model that was in my bathroom (my house was built in 2004 so the first one lasted about 15 years) AND the price is very reasonable! Pretty quick replacement, it took about 7 minutes to switch out from start to finish.
customer_reviews.author: Alison123

customer_reviews.title: Repacement....easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement. Couldn't have been easier...take off the cover, unplug and remove the old motor, plug the new one in, pop into place and put on the new cover. If you already have a Broan installed, replacement is a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well but super loud
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these to replace the motor on my 20 year old bathroom fans. These are the perfect replacement for those as they are the same exact design and size. This makes switching the motor out very simple and quick. But one of the fans is so loud that the sounds scares my cats - maybe it's defective. Other than that they are good.
customer_reviews.author: ANNE M T

customer_reviews.title: What I was Looking for..
customer_reviews.text: Replaced the ones in my house without having to remove the whole unit..I just took the motor and fan assembly and put in place of the old one..Quicker and way cheaper...the fan assembly alone was $48.00 plus shipping and hard to find..I saved money this way
customer_reviews.author: Brother D

customer_reviews.title: good and well priced
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an old fan in a bathroom, the size was almost exactly the same, with the vent on the same side as the old fan. Though as a replacement unit though, this unit is made for new work (had to tear out some drywall to mount the fan to the ceiling studs. But it's a quality fan unit that works well.
customer_reviews.author: Rem Shropshire

customer_reviews.title: Overall good deal.
customer_reviews.text: Had a few cosmetic defects. Easily fixed (I'm a carpenter/handyman so I'm used to dealing with the issues it had). No complaints. Overall satisfied with my first "used item" purchase on Amazon. Saved a few bucks in the process by buying used.
customer_reviews.author: Darrin Davis

customer_reviews.title: BROAN for life
customer_reviews.text: Great Great Great price!! Thought I was buying just the cover because one of mine broke! It was the whole fan and everything. I have two of these and are both over ten years old in 2 of my 3 baths! Work great, well built! BROAN for life customer!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer N Brown

customer_reviews.title: Best for small to medium bathroom.
customer_reviews.text: This items is a very good replacement for old or none working exhaust. It has one been of the cleanest vacuum sounding low cfm fan I heard. Warning read the measurements before changing out old with this, the housing is very small. For best results try placing directly above or in closest proximity toilet or bathtub, to minimize exhaust time use.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: Waaay Better than I had expected ! It exhausts well & is a lot quieter then expected. I'm very Happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Gene, Gene

customer_reviews.title: For less than 20$?
customer_reviews.text: does not have loud sound, works fine, didn’t fit my bathroom so I only use it when I cook inside and it gives me no problem. I’m sure it work fine in a small- medium sized bathroom shame that it didn’t fit mine
customer_reviews.author: Geo

customer_reviews.title: Replaced a 25 yr old bathroom exhaust vent perfectly.
customer_reviews.text: It's not what I consider "easy"--that would be like replacing a light bulb. But it's pretty straight-forward for what it is. I'm happy because it arrived really quickly and it was exactly as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Herring

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Simply this is the best you can buy for the money. It is a little loud but it has great suction. Installation was easy and the best part is that later if it gets old and damaged you can exchange just the motor and not the whole metal housing.
customer_reviews.author: Victor M. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, works well
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my other fan, the exact same model, that died after probably 15 years in use. It was very easy to replace, the directions are clear and it came with all the parts. The fan does it job well for our size bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: Know your model number to make sure insides are replacable.
customer_reviews.text: I did not use the frame as it was impossible to attach without ceiling repair. But it was easy to remove the fan and motor and just insert it into the frame already installed in my ceiling. Perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: J. P. Hale

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Like many other reviews, I ended up just replacing the fan and not the enclosure of an old existing unit. Specifications (to make sure we were looking at the size needed) and instructions easy to understand. Took longer to vacuum/clean inside the old housing.
customer_reviews.author: Waddles

customer_reviews.title: Using as a vacuum in a makeshift airbrush paint booth
customer_reviews.text: Super inexpensive way to add ventilation to an airbrush paint booth. I mounted to 3/4" pvc, added a switch and extension cord with a filter across the front and 3" wide hose to move the air out.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond V. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Great price, relatively quiet, and easily handles a bathroom at the top limit of its declared ability. My only gripe is that having to go to the attic to screw it to the stud makes it more of a PITA than it needs to be.
customer_reviews.author: suave

customer_reviews.title: Just as expected. Watched a couple of You Tube ...
customer_reviews.text: Just as expected. Watched a couple of You Tube videos and replaced the non-working builder-grade fans of the same brand. Not the easiest project, but not the worst--especially if you have replaced light fixtures before. We were able to skip entering the attic and still have everything hooked up properly. Hooray!
customer_reviews.author: Nora

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in the product Mainly because it seemed to be a return And was taped up as such Missing parts I made it work but not thrilled
customer_reviews.author: firewife

customer_reviews.title: It's quieter than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: It's quieter than I expected. To be fair I'm not using this in a bathroom but in my cat's litter area to remove dust and smells to the outside. That for the price I was expecting something louder.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kumor

customer_reviews.title: Does its job
customer_reviews.text: Easy install after getting into the attic. really does a good job, just enough noise to give you privacy. Also does a great job sucking the steam out of the bathroom during showers. Would purchase another one if our other fan ever fails.
customer_reviews.author: ben

customer_reviews.title: This is a great fan and was easy to install. Was very happy with us and good price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great fan and was easy to install. Was very happy with us and good price even cheaper than Big box hardware stores and as always fast and easy delivery
customer_reviews.author: AMZ Shopper

customer_reviews.title: It looks simple, but...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't been able to get the previous identical fan completely out of the ceiling. The previous owners of the house removed the fan and painted the casing, sealing it in. I'll probably have to pay to get someone to install. I liked the old one until it died. I'll update my review once I get it replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Tant

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install works great
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about the fan due to the price. At the hardware store the cheapest I could find was $100. At $15 something had to be amiss. But I ordered it none the kids and after about 10 minutes it was installed and working like a champ. It may be a little noisier than suggested, but I like the background noise to drown out my own noises. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Bahen

customer_reviews.title: No problems! Cheap and effective unit
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, incredibly inexpensive, and it works! Previous ventilation fan didn't have the output for duct work, so installing this unit in the place of the previous unit involved the contractor installing an output on the roof.
customer_reviews.author: John Duffet

customer_reviews.title: Noise is not as bad as some say.
customer_reviews.text: This replaced the original fan that worked for many years. It is inexpensive and looks good. It is in a rental so I do not know how well it works.
customer_reviews.author: JC Cats

customer_reviews.title: Nice replacement
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit to replace and old one that stopped working. I couldn’t find just the fan replacement alone that fits the old box. This entire unit was cheaper than just the fan and motor. Great deal and works.
customer_reviews.author: Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: A little noisy, pretty good airflow, great price.
customer_reviews.text: A little noisy. It is smaller than the one I took out. But it works. Great price. The noise is fine. You have to remember to turn it off or pull the heat or cooling out of the house. I have one that is quiet, a little too quiet. People forget to turn it off.
customer_reviews.author: RBW

customer_reviews.title: It’s got noise!
customer_reviews.text: It’s really noisy, but that’s what I wanted, because when women use the restroom, they don’t want other to hear them, so it’s a winner my wife says!
customer_reviews.author: Skidsteer85xt

customer_reviews.title: I Love This Fan!!!
customer_reviews.text: So noisy, it creates all the privacy I want (air flow noise, not buzzing or humming). I don't like anyone listing to my business. 50 CFM in a 5ft by 8ft bathroom is way more than enough. Clears the air in less than a minute. Easy to connect. Came just as pictured. I love, love, love this fan.
customer_reviews.author: C Perez

customer_reviews.title: Great fan, Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Great fan, Easy to install. I had to replace my old bathroom fan cuz it was making a funny noise. I got the same model and installation was easy, I didnt install the whole box housing since i was able to use the rest and for the price, you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Angel

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Our bathroom exhaust fan stopped working so we ordered this one. It was shipped quickly and was very easy to install. It only took my husband a few minutes to take down the old one and put this one in. It works much better than our old one and really helps to pull the steam out of the bathroom after someone takes a shower.
customer_reviews.author: Bluebird80

customer_reviews.title: so far so good. It retro fits into the old ones
customer_reviews.text: so far so good. It retro fits into the old ones, so I only had to pop out the old fan and then pop in the new one. I was able to leave the electrical connection with wire nuts intact. I appreciate this consistency from one product gen to the next. honestly, our old one lasted a long time too, with continuous long usage cycles.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Banana recommends

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my office bathroom. It's quite loud but I wanted that to help mask the noise as the bathroom is joined with our break room. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kerri S

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.....
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty much an exact replacement for the exhaust fan in my home. Very easy to install....took about 5 minutes and it works as it should.
customer_reviews.author: W. Caple

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to reassemble
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what is the language origin of Broan, but in the case of this fan, the translation of Broan into English is GARBAGE! Impossible to reassemble after wiring to house current.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Long

customer_reviews.title: but its ridiculously cheap and crazy easy to install
customer_reviews.text: YES this is the builder grade standard for the bathroom ventilation fans, but its ridiculously cheap and crazy easy to install. You can read the provided instructions or watch a video on youtube- just type in broan model 688 and you'll find videos. This works great for a small bathroom, I can't vouch for a large one. This fan IS loud, but for the price I'm not complaining. It does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Peaceful Pines

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This fan is amazing in a small bathroom but it is loud but for the price i don't care if it's loud. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Future A.

customer_reviews.title: Good fan replacement for the budget
customer_reviews.text: Really nice budget replacement for my really old and noisy fan! There is still some noise from this fan too. The noise difference between my old and new fan is not too much. But I do love how this fan's vibration is significantly less then my old fan (where it would create a buzz saw kind of noise throughout the entire floor).
customer_reviews.author: Sahil K

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: pros: Installed easily cons: None taking into account price to performance. Been debating one of those $200 fans but this does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Zachry

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We need a smaller unit with a lower height to fit into a limited space in the bathroom. For the size, and the price, we couldn't have been happier. This is a strong, high quality fan that looks nice installed. Very very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Frank T.

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: Recently moved into a home, the fan was making a horrific noise, luckily found this one, ordered, husband replaced the noisy fan, all quiet....came quickly
customer_reviews.author: KDW

customer_reviews.title: Great, basic fan!
customer_reviews.text: Great fan, easy installation, exactly the one I usually get at Lowe’s... except I didn’t have to leave my house! Woo!
customer_reviews.author: LilHappy

customer_reviews.title: Can’t find better performance and quality within same price range.
customer_reviews.text: Installed one in each bathroom at a church. The sound is a little loud but works great for a cover sound.
customer_reviews.author: kat

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and works great!
customer_reviews.text: Easy install and works great! Replaced a 688-k and it fit like a glove. Excellent price, super fast shipping and works as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Irma Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Bare bones fan, but works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: While a bit on the noisy side, it was quieter than most fans I've seen. I packed insulation around it and the noise level went down significantly.
customer_reviews.author: JD in KY

customer_reviews.title: Price and shipping
customer_reviews.text: Project works very good easy to install used as a wall mount Style also added a filter to it protect the motor
customer_reviews.author: mike crow

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but I'll bet its more than 4.0 sones...
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Just like the last one that went. Even sounds similar... but I was hoping for something a bit gentler on the ears. Really, a 4.0 sone level? I'd guess a 5 or so.
customer_reviews.author: RBH

customer_reviews.title: Love the price and new face plate
customer_reviews.text: This fan has been in our bathroom for 8 years and the fan finally wore out!!! I purchased this and took the inner panel out and replaced it and had minimum work to do, Love the price and new face plate!!!
customer_reviews.author: WildWillie

customer_reviews.title: This fan blows (or sucks)!
customer_reviews.text: This is a low-end, no-frills fan that simply works. I purchased this fan because the motor it contains happens to be an exact replacement for the 25 year-old motor in my bathroom fan that recently ceased. Replacing solely the motor was going to to cost $25-$30 at the hardware store and it would had to been ordered. The motor I harvested from this Broan model bolted on to the motor mount plate of the original Nu-Tone model and insterted nicely into the old fan box. I replaced the old vent cover with the new one. Like new!
customer_reviews.author: myflatsix

customer_reviews.title: Bathroom
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure how this sounds or works due to the fact I have not installed it yet into my new bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Hill

product_meta.title: Broan-NuTone 688 Ceiling and Wall Ventilation Fan, 50 CFM 4.0 Sones, White Plastic Grille
product_meta.description:
Style:50 CFM, 4.0 SonesMake sure your home is comfortable with Broan's Ventilation Fan! This ventilation fan does it all - from eliminating humidity or stubborn odors such as tobacco or garlic, the exhaust fan has got it covered. This compact unit is designed to fit easily between ceiling joists or wall studs - allowing you to place it wherever it's needed most! It features a plug-in permanently lubricated motor with a polymeric blower wheel to always provide the most efficient performance. It operates on 50 CFM with a 4.0 Sone rating to ensure a peaceful surrounding when in use. The fan features torsion springs grille mounting - no tools are needed! The white polymeric grille is paintable so it can be cohesive with your existing decor and wall color. The Broan's Ventilation Fan is perfect for your home.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Since 1932, Broan-NuTone LLC has led the industry with forward-thinking residential ventilation products, unsurpassed built-in convenience products and superior customer service. While global expertise plays a critical role in Broan-NuTone's ability to being able to meet and exceed the needs and desires of homeowners and designers alike, Broan-NuTone is very proud of the fact that over 80 percent of their products sold in the United States are designed, engineered and manufactured in the United States with U.S. and imported parts. Manufacturing operations in the United States are located in Hartford, Wisconsin and Cleburne, Texas, with customer and technical services located in Hartford and in Cincinnati, Ohio. Broan-NuTone is committed to developing revolutionary products that improve the indoor environment as well as implementing procedures to preserve the outdoor environment. Broan is the industry leader of range hoods, ventilation fans, heater/fan/light combination units, Indoor Air Quality (IAQ) Fresh Air Systems, built-in heaters, whole-house fans, solar powered attic ventilators and trash compactors. NuTone holds major market positions in door chimes, central vacuum systems, stereo intercom systems, home theater speakers, medicine cabinets, ironing centers, ceiling fans and ventilation fans. BEST range hoods are the "Ultimate in Kitchen Ventilation” featuring state-of-the-art performance and Italian design.
feature_bullets: VERSATILE FAN: Ventilation fan helps eliminate humidity, tobacco smoke, and cooking odors. Install the compact fan between ceiling joists or wall studs - wherever it's needed most!
EFFICIENT: Operates on 50 CFM and has a 4. 0 Sone rating to ensure a peaceful surrounding when in operation
EASY INSTALLATION: Torsion springs grille mounting - no tools necessary for a quick and easy installation
DECORATIVE: Paintable polymeric grilles allow you to ensure the fan is cohesive with your existing decor

FEATURES: Plug-in, permanently lubricated motor with the Broan-designed polymeric blower wheel for high-quality operation every time. Motor snaps in and out for easy cleaning - no screws required. Duct Diameter: 3 inch

specifications.Included Components: Broan 688 Ceiling and Wall Mount Fan, 50 CFM 4.0 Sones, White Plastic Grille
specifications.Warranty Description: One year warranty on parts and labor
